alert.note: Alert for Boone; Logan; McDowell; Northwest Raleigh; Southeast Raleigh; Wyoming (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 11:39PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Dickenson, Buchanan, McDowell, Raleigh, Wyoming, southeastern Logan and southeastern Boone Counties through 1215 AM EDT... At 1138 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Oceana to 9 miles west of Welch to near Clintwood. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Beckley, Welch, Clintwood, Grundy, Pineville, Haysi, John Flannagan Lake, Davenport, Mullens, Mabscott, Oceana, Sophia, Gary, War, Northfork, Piney View, Coal City, Prosperity, Hanover and Crab Orchard. This includes the following highways... West Virginia Turnpike between mile markers 34 and 52. Interstate 64 in West Virginia between mile markers 120 and 126. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, seek shelter inside a building until the storms pass. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Charleston West Virginia. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight EDT for southwestern Virginia...and central, southern and southeastern West Virginia.

area.areaDesc: Boone; Logan; McDowell; Northwest Raleigh; Southeast Raleigh; Wyoming
